body:
ok, I re-checked it; my editor did not gave me feedback from errors (only when the canonical import path was set) where it previously did and I attributed it to gofmt and goimports since that was what he is calling.

then I tried inside the shell and had the misconception that like e.g. `go build` one could omit the path to use the package of the current directory. Instead gofmt and goimports are waiting for input...

My testing was wrong, since the problem was my editor. (I did not use gofmt and goimports directly since they are integrated). so obviously my editor also go builds somehow before calling gofmt/imports.

sorry for the noise.
